Revisions to the IRM IRM Reference Description of Changes IRM 4.4.23.2 Retitled. Included instructions for various command codes. IRM 4.4.23.2.1 Form 6149 is obsolete. IRM 4.4.23.3 Consolidated and updated procedures. IRM 4.4.23.3.4 Retitled. Updated Form 5346, Examination Information Report, instructions IRM 4.4.23.4 Retitled. Included establishment process for field groups. IRM 4.4.23.5 Retitled. Included instructions for TEFRA cases.. IRM 4.4.23.6 Retitled. Provided information on rejects. Moved Form 5345-D instructions to Exhibit 4.4.23-3 IRM 4.4.23.7 Retitled. Provided information on subsequent requests for returns and who is allowed CC ESTAB in their IDRS profile. IRM 4.4.23.8 Retitled. Provided information on special situations. IRM 4.4.23.8.1 Retitled, Recoverable Retention Register (RRR) IRM 4.4.23.8.1.2 Moved to IRM 4.4.23.7 and updated. IRM 4.4.23.8.2 Moved to IRM 4.4.23.8.6 and updated. IRM 4.4.23.9 Retitled. Provided reference for retention schedule of forms. IRM 4.4.23.9.1 Removed. AM424 Input Documents
CC AM
posts transaction code (TC)
, Examination Request Indicator to the MF. Before the TC

is sent to MF the taxpayer identification number (TIN) and name control are validated against the National Account Profile (NAP) to ensure the TIN exists at master file and the name control matches the TIN. If the name control does not match you will receive a terminal reject. See Exhibit
for more examples of common rejects.
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing
Note: Prior to requesting AM
input, CC INOLE should be researched to the current name control at MF. (
) Once the TC

is sent to MF another check is performed. If all the data matches and a return has been filed, MF sends an opening record back AIMS with additional information such as the activity code, statute date, quent return indicator, etc. If a return has not been filed and a push code present, the TC
will remain at MF and an opening record will be when a return posts. After AIMS receives the opening record, the becomes fully established and AIMS sends a TC
, Examination back to MF. (
) Normally, if a TC
is present at master file, an AIMS opening will occur Friday following the Wednesday cut-off after the input of the CC AM
example, an AM
successfully input Thursday, January
through Wednesday, January
, will appear on the AIMS data base on Friday, February
For IMF, if the opening does not occur within this time frame, check the posted date of the TC
If the posted date of the TC is all zeroes, it means that MF is still processing the return which causes opening to be delayed approximately
weeks. (
) If a TC
posts to a tax period that is in Taxpayer Delinquency (TDI) Status
, a TC
will automatically be generated. The TC
is satisfying transaction which allows the module to be referred to (

, Audit Information Management System (AIMS) - AIMS Command Codes AMNON, AMTIN, AMBLK, AMREQ, AMLAB, for input information. Also see IRM
for information. (

, Pass-Through Entity Handbook.

) PSP provides policy guidance on the selection of cases and delivery of inventory for Examination. Examination Planning and Development (EPD) - creates the exam work plan and sets direct assignment criteria for routing exam work. Workloads are established on AIMS in PSP for: (cid:

) Priority Program and Project Coordination (cid:
) Campus orders for both: (cid:

) CDE is a web-based system designed for workload identification, and delivery of returns. CDE replaced the Midwest Automated Compliance System (MACS) for inventory delivery. See IRM
, Compliance Data vironment (CDE) - CDE Application and Use. Workload is also identified by running filters against tax return data in the CDE database. (
) Controls are not established until classified returns are ready to move to inventory. Opening requests for selected returns are sent to AIMS as CC AM
. For those returns Accepted as Filed a Disposal code
or
is to master file, nothing will post to AIMS. Campus users may use the CC AM
process or a tickler file created by CDE for requests. See IRM
, TC
Request and Tickler Files. (
) AIMS approval forms are not needed except when corrections are required after delivery. In this instance Form
, AIMS/ERCS Update, may be to update or correct a record. (
) Approval is made by National Office for return orders and CDE research requests (used for running filters).

PSP provides policy guidance on the selection of cases and delivery of inventory for Examination. Examination Planning and Development (EPD) creates the exam work plan and sets direct assignment criteria for routing of exam work. Workloads are established on AIMS in PSP for:

(08-07-2013) AIMS Establishment Process

The Campus TEFRA Function (CTF) will send Form 6658, Notice of Special Investor Action, with the attached Schedule K-1, to the controlling area. Unless the status code is 06 or 08, the CTF will request that the AIMS database be transferred to the CTF because of the partnership linkage.

) Once PCS linkage is established a Partnership Investor Control Files indicator will be present on AIMS. The PICF code for the partner return and Freeze either
or
and will prevent the return from closing on AIMS if PCS

) AIMS freeze code “H”is input by the CTF to prevent the partnership from closing prematurely. The freeze code appears on the AMDISA. (

” is input by the CTF to prevent the closure of a return that would have a PICF code of “

) The AM
AIMS opening request can reject immediately at the IDRS upon input or when attempting to post to the MF. For users inputting Rejects requests through ERCS, see the ERCS Group Handbook, Chapter
Tax Return, on the AIMS/ERCS website at: Request Tax Return for information. (
) The AM
opening request can reject at the IDRS terminal for a variety reasons. The error message should be printed, attached to the Form Terminal Rejects or Form
-B request and returned to the originator for correction. IRM
, AIMS Command Code AM
, contains explanations of the error messages. (
) The AM
opening request can also reject when attempting to post at These types of rejects will appear on the TC
Reject Register which is File Rejects tributed to each Area office on a weekly basis. See IRM
, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Reports, for an explanation of the TC
reject register. (

4.4.23.7.1.1 (08-07-2013) Paper Filed Return Request
CC ESTAB is used to enter requests for paper returns (as well as requests for closed audit files, prior partial assessments, amended returns, etc.).

For field office personnel, access to CC ESTAB is limited to local AIMS/ ERCS personnel. For Headquarters personnel, access to CC ESTAB may be approved by the Headquarters IDRS analyst. To request a CC ESTAB for a paper return, send a completed Form 2275, Records Request, Charge and
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions

Recharge, to your local AIMS/ERCS analyst using the contact list located AIMS/ERCS Personnel Listing. Forms may be submitted via mail, e-mail fax. SB/SE employees must obtain territory manager approval prior to mitting the request for the input. See IRM
, Command Code ESTABD, for more information. (
) Returns filed electronically are available on: (cid:

, Modernized e-File Request (
) Electronically filed returns can be requested using IDRS CC ELFRQ, CC TRDBV or CC TRPRT. ELF Requests Note: Effective
when inputting a TRPRT request after the return has been established on AIMS, you will need to obtain the TRPRT print Control-D. See your local AIMS/ERCS analyst for assistance with (
) CC ELFRQ is used at the campus level. See IRM
, Command ELFUP and ELFRQ for more information. (
) CC TRDBV and CC TRPRT are located on the Tax Return Data Base See IRM
, Command Codes TRDBV, TRERS, TRPRT, and R
, more information. (
) The Employee User Portal (EUP) allows employees to access electronically filed returns through the Return Request and Display (RRD) subsystem. e-File (MEF) includes M
returns. Requests for access to the EUP are processed by the business unit. Contact your manager to request access. (

) Most LB&I returns will have an LB&I Image Network (LIN) link to access return using a password protected process. LB&I groups can request the Campus Request link if there is an open AIMS control in Ogden or an AIMS control assigned the group. SBSE groups must request the original return from Files as they not currently have the ability to access LIN links. (
) Both LB&I and SB/SE have request forms and instructions titled, “Ogden Database Request Form” available on the AIMS website found at: Website, under the Codes/Procedures tab. (

) A filed claim or amended return must be reviewed by the examiner during audit. To obtain the amended return, determine if it has been scanned by Return/Claim Correspondence Imaging System (CIS). To determine if a return is a CIS image, review CC TXMODA control history section for a CIS locator code. letters “CIS.......” will appear under the “ACTIVITY” column of the TXMODA. present, request a transcript from your local CIS contact following CC procedures. See IRM

for CC ESTAB procedures. Local CIS users can be found by contacting your area’s AIMS/ERCS staff, listed here: AIMS/ERCS Personnel Listing. If no CIS code is present, CC ESTAB be used to request the DLN of the TC
Note: If the amended return has been adjusted, CIS Code
will appear on IMFOLA or BMFOLA.

Recharge, to your local AIMS/ERCS analyst using the contact list located at AIMS/ERCS Personnel Listing. Forms may be submitted via mail, e-mail or fax. SB/SE employees must obtain territory manager approval prior to sub- mitting the request for the input. See IRM 2.3.17.2 , Command Code ESTABD, for more information.

A filed claim or amended return must be reviewed by the examiner during an audit. To obtain the amended return, determine if it has been scanned by the Correspondence Imaging System (CIS). To determine if a return is a CIS image, review CC TXMODA control history section for a CIS locator code. The letters “CIS.......” will appear under the “ACTIVITY” column of the TXMODA. If present, request a transcript from your local CIS contact following CC ESTAB procedures. See IRM
for CC ESTAB procedures. Local CIS users can be found by contacting your area’s AIMS/ERCS staff, listed here: AIMS/ERCS Personnel Listing. If no CIS code is present, CC ESTAB should

) Special situations can occur that result in extra processing steps. for these potential situations prior to input will eliminate AIMS opening delays. Some common special situations include: (cid:

) Combat Zone (

) Older, inactive tax periods are moved to the RRR. Prior to requesting AIMS controls, these records must be brought back to active status. If they are on retention at the time of input, the request will reject. Follow the procedures below to bring the account back to MF: a. Secure an IMFOLI if the return is for an individual or a BMFOLI if the return is for a business. An “R” in the first column of the IMFOLI/BMFOLI indicates the master file tax code (MFT) and tax period in retention. b. To remove the tax period from the retention register, input IMFOLB or BMFOLB as appropriate. Print out the “Request Completed” screen and save for your records. c. The Message “RRR RE-ESTABLISHMENT PENDING” will appear on the IMFOLT and “RETENTION” will appear on the BMFOLT. d. Monitor the IMFOLT/BMFOLT for the “RRR RE-ESTABLISHMENT PENDING” or “RETENTION” to drop off (approximately
weeks). e. Once the “RRR RE-ESTABLISHMENT PENDING” or “RETENTION” off, a TC
will post for an individual return and a TC
will post for business return. f. AIMS/ERCS controls can be established when the TC
or TC
posted. (
) See IRM
, Command Code IMFOL, for additional IMF information and IRM
, Command Codes BMFOL and BMFOR, for additional BMF

Older, inactive tax periods are moved to the RRR. Prior to requesting AIMS controls, these records must be brought back to active status. If they are on retention at the time of input, the request will reject. Follow the procedures below to bring the account back to MF:
4.4.23.8.1 (08-07-2013) Recoverable Retention Register (RRR)

a. Secure an IMFOLI if the return is for an individual or a BMFOLI if the return is for a business. An “R” in the first column of the IMFOLI/BMFOLI indicates the master file tax code (MFT) and tax period in retention. b. To remove the tax period from the retention register, input IMFOLB or BMFOLB as appropriate. Print out the “Request Completed” screen and save for your records. c. The Message “RRR RE-ESTABLISHMENT PENDING” will appear on the IMFOLT and “RETENTION” will appear on the BMFOLT. d. Monitor the IMFOLT/BMFOLT for the “RRR RE-ESTABLISHMENT PENDING” or “RETENTION” to drop off (approximately
weeks). e. Once the “RRR RE-ESTABLISHMENT PENDING” or “RETENTION” drops off, a TC
will post for an individual return and a TC
will post for a business return. f. AIMS/ERCS controls can be established when the TC
or TC
have posted. See IRM
, Command Code IMFOL, for additional IMF information and IRM
, Command Codes BMFOL and BMFOR, for additional BMF infor- mation.
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions

Reopening AIMS Records If current AIMS status is 90 and: Then process the reopening by: the return was closed examined Completing Form 5348 requesting CC AMSTUR. Send the form to your local AIMS/ERCS analyst or AIMS coordinator for input. The AMSTUR can be input if the current date is at least 21 days from the status 90 date. See Note (1). the return was closed non-examined Non-examined closings do not require a waiting period prior to reopening. Complete Form 5348 requesting CC AMSTUR. Send the form to your local AIMS/ERCS analyst or AIMS Coordinator for input. the case was previously closed from Appeals. The return must be allowed to drop from AIMS prior to re-establishing the record on AIMS. Appeals closures can not be reopened. See Note (2).
Note: (
) Reopenings using CC AMSTUR will set a TC
IND-

, blocking all sequent non-examined closures. Also, the record will not be able to transfer out of the area during the current processing cycle.The AIMS reopening will not reopen the ERCS record. ERCS controls must be reopened manually. ERCS users should use menu option “Establish to reopen the ERCS record. Note: (
) To determine when a record will drop from AIMS, see IRM
Criteria of AIMS Data Base. (
) If the current AIMS record is not available, it has “dropped from AIMS” may be requested as a normal examination using AIMS command code AM
ERCS users will answer “Y”, Yes, when prompted if this is a examination. See IRM
, AIMS Procedures and Processing Reopening/Reclosing/Reinputting Records for additional reopening (

) Push codes are a three digit code input at the time of request for unfiled returns, substitute for returns and delinquent returns. They are also used process requests for cases that would otherwise reject, such as Criminal vestigation Division (CID) controlled cases. In instances where there is no TC
posted, the use of push codes will allow a TC
to post at MF bring the account under AIMS control. See IRM
, AIMS and Processing Instructions, Introduction, for a complete list of push

(1) Reopenings using CC AMSTUR will set a TC300 IND-6, blocking all sub- sequent non-examined closures. Also, the record will not be able to close or transfer out of the area during the current processing cycle.The AIMS reopening will not reopen the ERCS record. ERCS controls must be reopened manually. ERCS users should use menu option “Establish Control” to reopen the ERCS record.
) Reopenings using CC AMSTUR will set a TC
IND-

, blocking all sub- sequent non-examined closures. Also, the record will not be able to close or transfer out of the area during the current processing cycle.The AIMS reopening will not reopen the ERCS record. ERCS controls must be reopened manually. ERCS users should use menu option “Establish Control” to reopen the ERCS record.
If the current AIMS record is not available, it has “dropped from AIMS” and may be requested as a normal examination using AIMS command code AM

The following are some reasons why accounts are established NMF: a. The TP does not have a TIN. b. In the case of non

filed returns, MF establishment will remain a skeletal record until a return posts. On occasion, NMF AIMS controls can be used which will cause the records to appear on an inventory validation listing (IVL) and statute tables. c. Accounts that cannot be established on MF AIMS because of a MF reject.

) All Estate tax returns are automatically opened on AIMS as soon as a TC posts. AIMS controls are opened at the Cincinnati Campus. Their AIMS Gift Tax assignee code (AAC) is determined by the decedent’s zip code. (
) Form
, U.S. Estate Tax Return is requested using the SSN of the decedents, followed by the letter “V” (NNN-NN-NNNNV). (
) For Form
A, United States Additional Estate Tax Return, use the SSN of the heir. (
) The heir’s SSN can have only one Form
A account established on AIMS a time. Additional accounts must be controlled using temporary TINs. (
) Foreign Estates or Trusts will file Form

NR, Nonresident Alien Income Return, to report income received. This can include foreign fiduciaries with respect to a foreign trust or estate with income from U.S. sources. Opening requests must be made to the NMF database at the Cincinnati Submission Processing Center. See IRM
, International Returns and Analysis - Miscellaneous Tax Returns, for more information. Note: A Form
NR filed by a non-resident alien individual using a Social Security or Individual Tax Identification Number (SSN or ITIN) can be processed on the IMF as any normal Form

4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions
This Page Intentionally Left Blank

Note: AIMS openings can have various time frames depending on the record type, possible non-filing or systemic issues. The listed time frames should be used as an example only. Individual cases may vary.
AIMS records can be referred to as “skeletal AIMS” or “full AIMS” depending on the current status of the opening.
Research CC AMDISA to differentiate between skeletal AIMS or full AIMS control.
How to tell if an AIMS record is skeletal or full
Note: Skeletal records cannot be closed using an examined disposal code.
The opening date will help you determine when a record will be full AIMS.

AIMS Openings Schedule using: then: skeletal AIMS record the day following approval; full AIMS record within 9-15 days AM424 skeletal AIMS record immediately; full AIMS record within 9-15 days AMNON full AIMS record immediately TSLOD skeletal record the day following input; full AIMS within 9-15 days.
4.4 AIMS Procedures and Processing
Exhibit 4.4.23-2 (08-07-2013) Common AIMS Opening Rejects
AIMS openings must pass multiple validity checks prior to establishing a record. Common rejects and the lution for each are shown below.

AIMS Opening Reject Messages Reject Solution Account already established. Contact group currently controlling record and determine where the examination will occur. If necessary, have current group transfer control. Note: To avoid this reject, ensure that a current CC AMDISA is pulled prior to request. Name Control Mismatch Input IDRS CC INOLE to determine current name control. No TC 150 Present at Masterfile If IMF, research potential spouse filing. If no filing present, initiate non-filer procedures if necessary. TC 150 present at Masterfile/push code used Remove push code and resubmit. Research to determine if the taxpayer is a non-filer.
Based on the order of items listed on Form 5345-D, Examination Request-ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, Rev. 01–2012.

If not present, review TXMODA for pending set controls as a non-filer utilizing the correct push code. c. INOLE(S/T) - Review for current name control and filing requirements. Assignment Section: a. PBC, Primary Business Code - Three digit code that indicates the area/SBSE or questing control. b. Examiner’s ERCS Empl. ID - Four or five digit code of examiner requesting control e. Examiner’s ERCS Empl. Name - self-explanatory f. TIN, MFT & Form Type - One TIN and MFT per Form

Source Code - See AIMS/ERCS website Codes and Procedures section for the Source Aid at: Source Code Job Aid. d. Status Code - self-explanatory e. Statute Date - self explanatory.
